unnormalised: So, there I was, at the Indira Gandhi International Airport, waiting to board my flight to Goa. You know, the usual drill - oversized backpack, slightly panicked expression, and the nagging feeling that I've forgotten something crucial (usually my charger). This time, though, the universe decided to throw a curveball, in the form of, well, my PNR number.

unnormalised: Now, I pride myself on being reasonably organised. I even colour-code my socks (don't judge!). But travel? Travel turns me into a walking, talking disaster zone. My boarding pass, which I *swear* I had safely tucked away, decided to play hide-and-seek. After a frantic five-minute search that involved upending my backpack and narrowly avoiding a security alert (turns out a samosa isn't a dangerous weapon), I found it. Victory!

unnormalised: Except, the gate agent asked for my PNR number. And suddenly, my brain turned to mush. I could remember my anniversary (mostly!), my ATM PIN (after a few tries), but a simple six-character alphanumeric code? Nope. Gone. Vamoosed. Vanished into the black hole that resides where my short-term memory should be.

unnormalised: I started reciting random letter-number combinations, hoping something would stick. "ABC123? DEF456? XYZ789?" The gate agent, bless her soul, maintained a professional smile, but I could see the amusement twinkling in her eyes. It was about then I started sweating. And contemplating a career change to become a hermit in the Himalayas.

unnormalised: Then, like a beacon of light in the darkness, I remembered my trusty smartphone. "Aha!" I exclaimed, channeling my inner Sherlock Holmes. "I'll just pull up my booking confirmation email!" But, because the universe clearly has a vendetta against me, the airport WiFi decided to stage a protest. "No internet connection," my phone declared mockingly. My booking ref. was nowhere to be found either.

unnormalised: Desperate, I rummaged through my wallet, past expired loyalty cards and receipts for chai from 2018, and there it was. Scrawled on a tiny piece of paper, next to a hastily scribbled shopping list: "Goa flight: J4K9L2." My PNR!

unnormalised: The relief washed over me like a cool sea breeze on a hot summer day. I rattled off the code to the gate agent, who finally scanned my boarding pass with a sigh of (mostly) concealed exasperation. As I boarded the plane, I vowed to get a tattoo of my PNR. Or at least write it on my forehead. Flight no. 6E-123 was the saving grace for me at that point! Lesson learned: travel identifiers are more important than matching socks. And maybe I should invest in a carrier pigeon. They seem more reliable than airport WiFi, to be honest. And never forget your booking reference ID!
